Objects.Description: A small, black skeleton key lies in the dirt.

Objects.Description: A bronze key with intricate wards lies here.

Objects.Description: A huge key, made of black iron, lies here.

Objects.Name: key blued steel
Objects.Description: A small key of blued steel lies here.

Objects.Name: key red
Objects.Description: A red-colored steel key lies unnoticed in the dust.

Objects.Name: key golden
Objects.Description: A golden key brazed to a fine gold ring lies here.

Objects.Name: key silver
Objects.Description: An ornate silver key lies on the ground, unwanted.

Objects.Name: key copper
Objects.Description: An iron key has been copper plated to keep off rust.

Objects.Name: cheese
Objects.Description: A large wedge of cheddar cheese gathers a lovely mold here.

Objects.Name: key bright iron
Objects.Description: This bright iron key can open a lock, somewhere.

Objects.Name: juice brew strange bottle juice
Objects.Description: A large lumpy bottle of some strange brew is here.

Objects.Name: chest bronze
Objects.Description: A bronze chest, made ugly with grotesque bas-reliefs, stands here.

Objects.Name: potion oily black
Objects.Description: A bottle of oily black liquid lies on its side.

Objects.Name: crown
Objects.Description: The crown of the Lonoyan king rolls by and falls flat with a clang.
Objects.ExtraDescription: As you turn the crown over in your hands, you feel twice the warrior you usedto be, ready even to lead an army into battle.  Surely no magic can harm such agreat one as wears this crown.

Objects.Name: whisky bottle scotch whisky
Objects.Description: A bottle of Inver House blended whiskey lies here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is sealed with a metal cap.  You KNOW this stuff is bad,bad,bad.  It isprobably not single-malt.  More likely eight malt.

Objects.Name: bowl stew bigos
Objects.Description: A steaming bowl of Polish hunters' stew has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is the famous Polish hunters' stew that was immortalized in AdamMickiewicz' epic poem Pan Tadeusz.  Venison and other meats are boiled withkapusta (sauerkraut) to make a delicious dinner, fit for King Korbor of Lonoya.

Objects.Name: apple
Objects.Description: A lovely yellow apple with gold flecks and red cheeks lies here.

Objects.Name: walnuts nuts
Objects.Description: The squirrels have left a few nuts here.

Objects.Name: shirt
Objects.Description: A Lonoyan man's shirt lies in a crumpled heap.

Objects.Name: shortgown gown
Objects.Description: A Lonoyan woman's shortgown hangs forgotten on a nearby peg.

Objects.Name: pants breeches
Objects.Description: Some Lonoyan left in such a hurry, he forgot his breeches.

Objects.Name: skirt
Objects.Description: A skirt lies here.

Objects.Name: boots
Objects.Description: A pair of clodhoppers lies here.

Objects.Name: kerchief
Objects.Description: A kerchief lies here.

Objects.Name: bandanna neckerchief
Objects.Description: A large red neckerchief is draped over a stone.

Objects.Name: claymore sword
Objects.Description: A claymore lies here.

Objects.Name: claymore sword
Objects.Description: A beautiful claymore with an engraved hilt lies here.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Magic, Bless, AntiEvil, MagicUser, Cleric, Thief
Objects.ExtraDescription: The hilt is engraved with one word, a name ;it is the name "MacLeod".

Objects.Name: spear long
Objects.Description: A fifteen-foot spear is hung on the wall here.

Objects.Description: A hand axe lies here.

Objects.Name: chain mail shirt
Objects.Description: A shirt of chain mail lies in a heap.

Objects.Name: helm
Objects.Description: An open-faced helm lies on its side.

Objects.Name: green cloth cloak
Objects.Description: A pile of forest green cloth lies in a crumpled heap.

Objects.Name: cloak cloth red
Objects.Description: A pile of red cloth lies on the ground.

Objects.Name: cloak cloth blue
Objects.Description: A pile of blue cloth lies on the ground.

Objects.Name: cloak cloth green
Objects.Description: A pile of green cloth lies on the ground.

Objects.Name: backpack
Objects.Description: A backpack lies here.

Objects.Name: water flask pint water
Objects.Description: A glass flask lies here.

Objects.Name: water skin water
Objects.Description: A water skin lies here

Objects.Name: robe
Objects.Description: A many-pocketed robe lies here.

Objects.Name: robe
Objects.Description: A white robe lies here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This robe is worn by only the most prestigious.  An aura of peace andcontentment surrounds the robe.  Making it feel almost other worldly.  Thefabric is soft and very pliable.  This robe would be very comfortable to wear.

Objects.Name: shield medium wooden
Objects.Description: A medium-sized wooden shield lies in the dust.

Objects.Name: bow short
Objects.Description: A short bow lies here unstrung, its string wrapt round its stave.

Objects.Name: breastplate plate leather
Objects.Description: A breastplate made of leather hardened in hot oil lies here.

Objects.Name: jacket studded leather
Objects.Description: A leather jacket studded with metal plates lies in a heap.

Objects.Name: flask healing draught
Objects.Description: A small flask full of an aromatic, and alcoholic, fluid.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is engraved with these arcane runes:                      judicandus dies

Objects.Name: flask sight elixir
Objects.Description: A small flask of clear, glimmering liquid.

Objects.Name: flask life elixir
Objects.Description: A small flask of fragrant golden liquid.

Objects.Name: flask evil's bane potion
Objects.Description: A large vial of bubbling red fluid lies here, firmly capped.

Objects.Name: scroll
Objects.Description: A scroll labelled "To Augment Thy Craftsmanship" lies here.

Objects.Name: scroll
Objects.Description: A scroll labelled "To Bring the Spring Rains" lies here.

Objects.Name: scroll
Objects.Description: A scroll labelled "To Increase Thy Fighting Spirit" lies here.

Objects.Name: scroll
Objects.Description: A scroll labelled "The Legend of Nambor" lies here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The Legend of Nambor.    In days now forgotten to any but the living God, there lived a    valiant Man, Nambor by name, who dared enter the evil tunnels    in the bowels of the mountains.  From Symtoto he came, through    paths untrodden, until after great struggle he found a shaft    leading down into deep darkness.  But that was the start of poor    Nambor's trials, for he found the entrance was too high to leave    through. Now must he roam the tunnels of the evil creatures that    gnaw the rocks of the Underdark, till God shows him an escape    from the tunnels, or from this world.    And bravely he went forth, ever climbing deeper, sword clutched    in hand.  And 'tis said by the elves that he saw there many a    marvel; rocks that turned into vile beasts when touched, and    unseen creatures that lurked in the shadows.  And some there are    that say he escaped at last, but others say he never left, but    died in the dark, broken sword still in his hand.    And now these tunnels are full of goblins, yet still some of the    nameless things Nambor fought remain.  Where now is one willing    to enter and discover the ancient hero's fate? Where now is the    hero, to save Lonoya from the goblins?                                                     Cwell the Bard

Objects.Name: ring opal golden
Objects.Description: A fine gold ring set with an opal lies on the ground.

Objects.Name: gold
Objects.Description: A huge pile of gold is here.

Objects.Name: knife goblin
Objects.Description: A jagged black knife with a goblin-head carved on its hilt lies here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a hideous, leering goblin head carved in bone.

Objects.Name: scimitar goblin
Objects.Description: A blackened scimitar engraved with evil runes lies here.

Objects.Name: club goblin
Objects.Description: A large human bone set with cruel jagged spikes lies here.

Objects.Name: bow goblin
Objects.Description: A shortbow of ogre horn backed with sinew lies here.

Objects.Name: spear goblin
Objects.Description: A short spear with a broad blade lies here.

Objects.Name: poleaxe jagged goblin
Objects.Description: A jagged, black, rune-carved poleaxe is stuck into the ground.

Objects.Name: elven chainmail mail
Objects.Description: A hauberk of mithril rings lies here.

Objects.Name: elven bow
Objects.Description: An elvish bow of aurodiea wood lies here.

Objects.Name: broadsword sword fine krat
Objects.Description: A finely crafted broadsword must have been plundered from Lonoya.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The mark "D.  F.  " with a stamped-in hammer is on its hilt, and the bladebears the name "Krat".  Perhaps it is magic?  But its blade, at least, is verywell-tempered, and its edge razor-sharp.

Objects.Name: platemail red
Objects.Description: Some sturdy but ugly platemail has been painted over red. Doesn't help.

Objects.Name: mace huge black
Objects.Description: A huge black club with metal bands lies here.

Objects.Name: collar iron toadstool
Objects.Description: An iron collar lies in the dirt. It has some writing on it.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is in orcish:                     I AM TOADSTOOL THE MIGHTY                       NONE SHALL DEFEAT ME

Objects.Name: toadstool goblin head
Objects.Description: A severed goblin head lies here.  Looks tasty.

Objects.Name: goblin hide
Objects.Description: The hide of a goblin lies on the ground, smelling very bad.

Objects.Name: apron
Objects.Description: A frilly pink apron, stained with blood, is on the ground.

Objects.Name: scimitar horrible orcish
Objects.Description: A horrible jagged scimitar of orcish make is stuck into the ground.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Humming, NoDonate, NoInvis, Magic, NoDrop, AntiGood, AntiNeutral, Cleric, Thief, Warrior

Objects.Name: gold
Objects.Description: A gigantic mountain of plunder is piled in every corner.

Objects.Name: chest crude
Objects.Description: A crude wooden chest sits here.

Objects.Name: chest ebony
Objects.Description: An ebony chest sits here.

Objects.Name: chest pine
Objects.Description: A light chest of pine sits here.

Objects.Name: pick
Objects.Description: A mining pick lies here, discarded.

Objects.Name: pick orcish
Objects.Description: A mining pick lies here, discarded.

Objects.Name: tub
Objects.Description: A tub of dirty water for quenching tools sits here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It doesn't look too good.  I wouldn't drink it if I were you!

Objects.Name: well jakur
Objects.Description: You stand by the ancient Well of Jakur, delved thousands of years ago.

Objects.Name: wine fountain wine
Objects.Description: A magical fountain of marble spouts the blood-red wine.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The fountain is filled with cheap, but not sour, wine.

Objects.Name: safe picture
Objects.Description: A portrait of King Korbor in robes of state hangs on the wall.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is an oil-on-wood portrait of the good King.  No, you can't steal it, myfriend.  It is, strange to say, firmly bolted to the wall, not hung from theusual nail.

Objects.Name: waybread
Objects.Description: Some waybread has been placed here.
